column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The hanuman langur is beckoning to you with uncertain intent.
Speak with the strange hanuman langur and follow behind it.
Aid the Auri woman.
Speak with the Auri woman.
<chitter> <chitter> Heee!
<chitter> <chitter> Heeeheee!
It appears this creature wants you to follow it. What harm could come from doing so?
<chitter> <chitter> Heeehooo!
The creature appears to want you to follow it deeper into the jungle.
Follow the hanuman langur and try not to fall behind.
<chitter> <chitter> Hee! Heeehaaa!
The creature has guided you to this elderly Auri woman, but you have yet to discern why. However, it is plain that she requires aid.
You come upon an elderly Auri woman, bent over in pain and breathing haggardly. Provide what treatment to her that you can.
Thank...thank you. I feel much better now.
A terrible beast fell upon me, and I fled, quickly losing my bearings in the thick woods. This kindly creature guided me to safety, but my wounds pained me.
How long ago was that? Bells ago? Days ago? I cannot say...
<chitter> <chitter> Heee!
Of course, little friend. Thank you for delivering this kind soul to me. I owe you my life.
<chitter> <chitter> Heee! Heeeheee!
We shouldn't stay here, for nowhere outside the village gates is safe. I believe I can return safely on my own. Seek me out, and I shall see you are rewarded for what you've done.
Ah, my savior arrives at last! I feel right as rain now, and all thanks to your ministrations.
And that creature, of course. I haven't seen it since returning here...
The legends of this island say the hanuman langurs are servants of the divinities, appearing when they deign to show an interest in worldly affairs. I think there may be some truth to those tales.
I must remember to make an offering when I am able. As for <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> reward, however, please take this, and know that I shall never forget the goodwill you showed me.
